attributes.action: Fight for funding for an effective coastal defence scheme
attributes.background: The surge of December 2013 resulted in devastation and suffering for all the communities of Walcott, Bacton & Happisburgh. Many losses were catastrophic.Walcott and Bacton have been flooded twice, now, in seven years.
attributes.additional_details: Norman Lamb MP has been an ardent campaigner, supporting us and as a result of his support we achieved partial rock armouring at Ostend, Walcott. Following a meeting with him on Tuesday 30th August 2016, he has asked that I urge everyone in the communities whether you are a resident, a regular visitor, a business or holiday home owner to please sign this petition. The more evidential support we can show the government the better it will be for us all in securing extra funding towards a beneficial defence scheme.

attributes.action: Relevant services must come together to prevent lives lost in open water yearly.
attributes.background: One 2011 July day my son Dylan went swimming at a local quarry; 20 minutes in he got into difficulty, unable to swim the short distance to safety. He reportedly died from cold water shock which has 4 stages; probably in the last stage when everything that has fought to stay alive relaxes.
attributes.additional_details: A minute earlier Dylan's rescuer could have saved his life. Currently the UK has nothing in place to prevent these needless deaths. Schools don't educate about the dangers in & around open water & there is no funding in place for prevention. Since Dylan died there has been another 2000 water related deaths. I want Dylan’s death to serve a purpose rather than for him to have died in vain. I want people to live because Dylan died.  We need change and we need it  now!

attributes.action: UK should follow Donald Trump's policy and also put temporary travel ban
attributes.background: UK government should copy Donald Trump's policy and also impose a temporary travel ban on Syria, Lybia, Sudan, Yemen, Somalia, Iran and Iraq.

attributes.action: Make 8 weeks scans routine during pregnancy in addition to 12 & 20 weeks.
attributes.background: We experienced a missed miscarriage that wasn't picked up until our routine 12 weeks scan. Our baby had stopped developing 2 months previous at 5 weeks. Because the pregnancy had gone on so long I had to have surgical management which required a general anaesthetic and a overnight stay in hospital.
attributes.additional_details: Other developed countries offer routine scans at 8 weeks to pick up any concerns as early as possible. Why don't we have this in the UK? Recent studies show 45% of women who have had a miscarriage show signs of PTSD. When 20-25% of pregnancies end in miscarriage and up to 75% are in 1st trimester, earlier precautions should be essential. Because our pregnancy was so advanced I had to have a surgical miscarriage under general anaesthetic. The US and Australia offer 8 week scans and so should we.

attributes.action: Allow safe spaces for rough sleepers to camp
attributes.background: I have worked with homeless people who have been badly treated and ended up in dangerous situations sleeping on the streets. None asked to end up in this situation. Nobody asked to be beaten or spat at or to become ill due to the freezing temperatures. Safe camp sites to help temporarily.
attributes.additional_details: Statistics are rising and people are becoming even more vulnerable. Safe camp sites will allow people to commune to support each other, protect each other and have minor shelter from a tent. If this was legal there would be less crisis on the streets as support agencies will be able to access a larger volume of people and the vulnerable can get the help they require. This could also improve many social factors. Those with no homes should not be punished for looking for somewhere safe to sleep!!

attributes.action: Help disabled people to work by abolishing the cap on Access to Work payments
attributes.background: The Access to Work Scheme helps disabled people to work by paying for the extra costs they face. In April 2018, the Government is planning to impose an arbitrary cap on how much money a person can claim. This will make it far harder for disabled people to find and keep a job.
attributes.additional_details: ATW enables disabled people to work by paying for equipment, PAs or extra travel costs. From April 2018, people will not be able to claim over £40,800 a year. This cap will only save £3 million but make it almost impossible for severely disabled people to work and cause huge distress. It contradicts the Government’s aim to increase the number of disabled people with jobs. It also does not make economic sense. For every £1 spent on ATW, £1.48 returns to the Exchequer in tax or benefits savings.

attributes.action: Allow Scotland's emergency services to be VAT exempt just like others in the UK
attributes.background: The UK Government has refused to allow Scotland's newly formed Emergency services to be tax exempt which is the case for the rest of the UK's Emergency services. This is wrong and unjust a d needs to end immediately.
attributes.additional_details:
Millions are wasted by Police Scotland being unable to claim back VAT as other Police and fire services do.
It's completely illogical and unjust that Scotland should be forced to pay VAT without being able to reclaim it.

attributes.action: Guarantee accrued UK Pension rights for UK and EU Citizens.
attributes.background: We ask Parliament to guarantee pension rights that UK & EU Nationals have accrued whilst working in the UK or any EU country and an assurance that UK pensioners living in Europe will receive the annual increment applied to pensioners living in the UK; whatever the outcome of the Brexit negotiations.

attributes.action: Stop sales of arms to Saudi Arabia until there are no human rights concerns
attributes.background: Saudi Arabia has bought 1000's of missiles and bombs in recent years and more contracts for arms have been approved. British made weapons may now be in use in the conflict in Yemen. Saudi is on the list of countries the British Foreign office thinks are of human rights concern.

attributes.action: To teach UK pupils how food choices impact the environment
attributes.background:
No other single activity has a bigger impact on the planet than the raising of livestock for meat, milk and eggs.

By adding to the school curriculum we can introduce positive environmental change by educating pupils of how their buying behaviour and food choices effect the world we live in.
attributes.additional_details: http://science.time.com/2013/12/16/the-triple-whopper-environmental-impact-of-global-meat-production/

attributes.action: I want the government to put fibromyalgia as a disability by law!
attributes.background: Years ago I've never heard of this before until my nan got it then my mum got it, and I know so many people that have it now,  my mum worked as a carer for years and had to give it up, to get a sit down job, still hurts, but she needs it to pay mortgage and other bills, they don't get enough support
attributes.additional_details: When my mum first went to pip she ended up taking them to court and my mum won because they never showed up, and she got higher, now she's lower and nothings changed, her condition will never get better, so why should it be any different to the last ones, fibro should be classed as a disability by law and by the government  because it's a long term condition and affects the muscles. They need more support and more awareness of it, because so many people have it nowadays more common

attributes.action: Value the Arts and make them compulsory as part of Ebacc measures.
attributes.background: We need serious consideration from the government to include Arts and creative subjects (Music, Drama, Dance and Art) as part of the Ebacc measures. We have to stand up and fight for all the young musicians and creative students. We have to fight for our subject.
attributes.additional_details: Schools are cutting music from their curriculum and this is increasing nationally. Music is dying within our schools. Teachers of the arts know that the increasing importance being placed on Ebacc has contributed significantly to the sheer destruction of the Arts in school. Jobs are at risk and the heart of schools is being ripped out. Studying the Arts makes a much more well-rounded individual with a much wider skill set. Arts needs to be included to allow a “broad and balanced” curriculum.

attributes.action: Petition the House to debate a vote of no confidence in Mr Speaker Bercow.
attributes.background: Mr Speaker Bercow did, on the afternoon of February 6th 2017 cast aspersions on and make unfounded comments against the President of the United States of America.

attributes.action: Over-the-counter heartburn medication to warn, "see a GP if symptoms persist."
attributes.background: We call on Government to take steps to promote the earlier diagnosis of oesophageal cancer by requiring all packets of heartburn medication to carry an explicit warning of the importance of seeing a GP if symptoms persist for more than three weeks.
attributes.additional_details: The UK has the highest reported incidence in the world of oesophageal adenocarcinoma (OAC), a disease heavily associated with persistent and severe reflux and the precursor condition Barrett’s Oesophagus, that kills 7,700 people each year. Many people who develop OAC have been self-medicating on over-the-counter medication for years before their cancer diagnosis. Diagnosing, monitoring and treating Barrett’s Oesophagus is a key strategy for reducing the incidence of this cancer.

attributes.action: Fund care homes exclusively for vegetarians and vegans.
attributes.background: Vegetarians, mainly Hindus have strict vegetarian dietary needs which are not available in any care home facilities provided by the Government.
attributes.additional_details:
Our research has shown there is not a single care home manged by the Government that funds catering for the needs of Hindu Vegetarians.

Private care homes are beyond the reach of 90% of the Hindus hence it is a moral obligation on the part of the Government to cater for the needs of the Hindu Community and other Vegetarians. 

The National Congress of Gujarati Organisations UK, the largest Hindu Organisation in the UK with 860,000 plus members, has requested this petition.
attributes.creator_name: Chandrakant J ivraj Rabheru President of NCGO

attributes.action: Remove VAT (20%) on AEDs (Automated External Defibrillators)
attributes.background: Help us remove VAT on lifesaving defibrillators.  Did you know Scouts and Guides, Cubs and Brownies, Beavers and Rainbows all have to pay 20% VAT for this emergency life-saving equipment. It is wrong. These are the keenest young people to train and encourage with basic life support skills.
attributes.additional_details:
More defibrillators would be available if this ridiculous tax was removed. This will encourage more young people in their thousands to grow up as the next generation with life-saving skills and a keenness to help others.  Signing this petition could save a life!

Cheaper AEDs (No VAT)
= more AEDs in communities 
+ more young, prepared people to assist victims when a SCA has occurred 
= MORE LIVES BEING SAVED
…..Let’s make it happen

attributes.action: Hold a British Referendum on the UK's Foreign Aid Budget Contributions.
attributes.background: The British Foreign Aid Budget is currently 0.7pc of GDP. Give the British people a chance to decide how much of our money goes to other Countries for 'Aid'. This current Government are cutting our public services and increasing taxation when there is clearly more money to be found in other budgets.

attributes.action: Support Demilitration, Unification and Right of Self Determination for Kashmiris
attributes.background: Citizens of Jammu Kashmir were promised Right of Self Determination under UN Resolution of 13th August 1948 accepted by both India and Pakistan and supported by International Community including UK, with passage of time UK  changed stance to bilateral & territorial issue between both occupiers of JK
attributes.additional_details:
1)Jammu Kashmir was autonomous while India was ruled by British. On the 15th August 1947 British Rule came to an End. JK Maharaja was undecided about the future of JK. On 22nd & 27th October 1947 respectively, JK was invaded by Pakistan and India subsequently resulting in Bloodshed & Division of Jammu Kashmir. 

2)Late Lord Mountbatten who was first Governor General of India, accepted in a document in 1947 that the final settlement of Jammu Kashmir can only be determined by Citizens of Kashmir

attributes.action: All cyclist road users must have insurance and a cycling licence to use the road
attributes.background: As a car owner I have had incidents at the fault of a cyclist.  Damage was caused to my vehicle but because cyclist are uninsured I was unable to call any authority to pay for the damages.  Cyclists can note our registration and go to the police at any time who can then contact our insurance
attributes.additional_details: I was indicating to turn right but waiting for oncoming traffic to give way.  Cyclist overtook on my drivers side knocking my wing mirror off, dent and scratched my door.  Asked why he done that, he answered "sorry my fault, I thought I could get around in time"!  I stayed with him made sure he was OK called the ambulance. A few weeks later I received a letter from Metropolitan Police regarding the incident! I had to pay for the damages to my car although it was not my fault!

attributes.action: Reconsider the new Apprenticeship standard for Thermal Insulation Engineers
attributes.background:
In the late 1960's, the men of the insulation industry, then known as 'Pipe and Boiler Coverers' or 'Laggers', went on a 16 week strike. The purpose of the strike was simple, those men wanted 'craft status.' 

They achieved that and the new job title would be known as Thermal Insulation Engineer.
attributes.additional_details:
Why "Thermal Insulation Engineer?" or "TIE"
TIE's specialise in reducing thermal conductivity, preventing heat loss or heat gain in process pipe work, vessels, boilers often in complex configurations and difficult and dangerous locations.

With no consultation to work force or the unions, the UK government is removing our title 'Engineer' and replacing it with 'operative.' Please reconsider this matter

This has been our trade title for almost 50 years and we want it to remain exactly the same.

attributes.action: SEN Support for children without EHCPs should be as legally binding.
attributes.background: If a child has an EHCP the local authority and school and legally obliged and have a duty of care to ensure their needs are met. If a child is on SEN support but does not have an EHCP, legally the schools do not have the same obligations and so children are being let down and left unsupported.
attributes.additional_details: We would like to see this loophole being closed and ensure regardless of whether a child has an EHCP or not children who are offered SEN support are still being provided with the same opportunities and rights as a child with an EHCP. There are examples which can be provided of children who have SEN support without an EHCP who have had professional outside agencies visit the school and offer recommendations but the schools have ignored these and not put them into practice. We feel this is unfair.

attributes.action: Resolve the inconsistencies in refunding NHS trainees under the WAT Scheme.
attributes.background: The Widening Access Training Scheme was introduced in 1999 to broaden the professional knowledge of NHS workers. This scheme offered tax and NI exemption, yet many eligible NHS students were incorrectly taxed and paid NI. Reclaiming these payments is proving extremely difficult for many.
attributes.additional_details: A student salary is not classified as earnings and as such should not have been subject to tax or NI deductions. HMRC instructed NHS Trusts not to deduct tax/NI from such salaries and pledged to refund those who had already trained. NHS Trusts and HMRC are treating claimants inconsistently. Some have been refused a NI refund, despite The Social Security (Contributions) Regulations 2001 (regulation 25 and part 7 of schedule 3). Some claimants are still waiting for refund two years after claiming.

attributes.action: Stop all payments to Europe from the U.K.
attributes.background: To stop sending money to Eu now

attributes.action: FREE Junior use of council sports fields/ pitches and a cap on the Adult price.
attributes.background:
I want the Government to make local sports fields/pitches owned by any local councils FREE for use by junior sports teams (Under 18) and a Cap on the cost for Adult sports teams.

Councils are looking to earn money Instead of keeping our society fit and healthy!

SAVE OUR CHILDREN'S HEALTH!
attributes.additional_details:
Leeds City Council Charges...

2012/13 season...
Adults: £521 per team, per pitch
Junior: £191 per team, per pitch

2016/17 season
current charges..
Adults: £556 per team, per pitch
Junior: £215 per team, per pitch

The prices charged for pitches in Leeds goes up most years', meaning less and less Children can get involved with their local sports club as the price becomes a barrier for some families, especially those on low incomes or benefits.

attributes.action: Temporarily suspend the powers of devolution to Scotland.
attributes.background: The Scottish Government under the SNP have consistently failed to govern Scotland efficiently and effectively. Suspending devolution will allow a return to sensible and appropriate governance until such a time as a more accountable system, with suitable checks, can be established.
attributes.additional_details: Nearly every aspect of everyday life in Scotland is on the brink of disaster, from infrastructure maintenance through to the functioning of social services, health and education. Many farmers are near bankruptcy. Teachers have faced too much change without sufficient guidance, and standards in some areas have plummeted. The health service is in crisis with wards closing, waiting lists lengthening, insufficient doctors, nurses and cleaners and GP practices faltering under increased pressure.

attributes.action: To prevent seismic testing & fracking by Ineos in Dronfield & surrounding areas
attributes.background:
Ineos (owned by an offshore parent company) has been awarded the fracking rights by the Government for Dronfield and its surrounding areas. 
We believe fracking is unproven technology, environmentally damaging in numerous ways, presents a health risk to both the general public and its workers.
attributes.additional_details:
Dronfield Against Fracking oppose seismic testing & fracking for various reasons including:
1. Long term damage to countryside from an aesthetic point of view.
2. Risk of structural damage to property from damage to old mine workings from both horizontal and vertical drilling.
3. Large increase in traffic from HGV's on country roads.
4. Falling property prices.
5. Invalidate some household insurance policies from fracking damage.
6. Polluted waste water entering our water course in future years.

attributes.action: Intervene with executions of Ali Al-Nimr, Dawood Al-Marhoon, Abdullah Al-Zaher
attributes.background: Ali, Dawood, and Abdullah are young men who took a courageous stand for the oppressed religious minority groups in the country by partaking in peaceful protests. They were arrested as children in 2012 and have spent more than 1500 days in prison – mostly in solitary confinement.
attributes.additional_details: Saudi Arabia has a long history of human rights abuses. The Mabahith secret police agency detains political opponents, tortures, and interrogates them. This agency acts with impunity, and has affiliated prisons in which it keeps political dissidents in. The Islamic Human Rights Commission estimates 30,000 people have been kept in these prisons.

attributes.action: Don't allow train companies to increase fares until they improve their service
attributes.background:
Set up an independent website where unhappy customers can log their journey disruptions easily. Train companies can't skew the figures and true results can be recorded.

If service is not kept to a high standard with trains running on time, then they are not permitted to raise their prices.
attributes.additional_details:
Train companies have announced price hikes yet again across the board. Service is worse than ever, but prices are rising. The Delay Repay scheme is nothing short of a joke.

My train was running so late that they terminated it halfway, throw all of us off so they could skip the rest of the stops and arrive on time.  That is a clear case of skewing their own statistics of how many trains arrive 'on time' - with no care for the disruption they cause their own customers.

attributes.action: Save family run pubs from 2017's massive business rates increase.
attributes.background:
Business rates have increased by more than 100% for some pubs. 
The hardest hit are the small, family run businesses who are already struggling in competition with large chain pubs, giant pub companies and breweries.
attributes.additional_details:
The extra financial burden will prove fatal to small, family run pubs.
We urge the Government to give additional rate relief to local authorities to ensure the protection of such community assets.
Pubs not only employ local people, they are a community hub providing a meeting place, local entertainment and support for our local farmers and suppliers, community groups and charities. 
If the rate increases go ahead we will lose our independent pubs and all diversity in the hospitality industry.

attributes.action: Help women that go into pre term labour from 21 weeks plus
attributes.background:
If a lady goes into preterm labour before 24 weeks they're refused steroids, magnesium etc which can help their babies lungs, and could stop labour. 
I lost twins at 21w 6d, I was refused help in the days leading to their birth. They were alive nearly an hour and I was refused any help for them.
attributes.additional_details: After loosing twins at 21+6 weeks, I'm left wondering if someone had helped they would still be here today. Babies have been saved at 21 weeks before but my hospital refused to help. My babies measured the same as a 24 week pregnancy even though were twins as babies all grow at different rates. My babies were left to die with me holding them like they didn't matter. Yet they cried and breathed. I believe if born alive or early labour happens at 21 weeks plus things should be done to prevent it.

attributes.action: Regard nurseries as being exempt from the rise of business rates
attributes.background:
Nurseries are bracing themselves for business rate rises of up to 115 per cent from April 2017.

Nurseries will be forced to handover the costs to paying parent who use these services.

attributes.action: Get the baby's heel prick done within 24 hours of birth
attributes.background: The baby's heel prick is usually done between 5-7 days old. Sometimes this has been too late for conditions to be picked up on.
attributes.additional_details: I lost my little boy, Oliver-Rhys at 6 days old from MCADD which would have been picked up on in the heel prick, and we would have been able to save him. I have since had a little girl, Fjola-Rose since my loss and she was tested within 24 hours, it came back she did have MCADD too but we have been able to manage hers due to knowing. This shows that the test can be done this early. I want to change the dates so that less families have to go through the horrible ordeal.

attributes.action: Introduce longer fixed sentences for persistent serious offenders
attributes.background: Introduce longer fixed sentences for persistent serious offenders and tougher conditions and limits on their human rights whilst in prison
attributes.additional_details: My daughter was attacked by a persistent offender and very seriously injured.  She subsequently died as a result of her injuries and the psychological impact of the assault.  This offender will remain a risk to other people if he is ever released.

attributes.action: Hold a 2nd referendum which includes 2 million EU Nationals living in Britain.
attributes.background:
Did the EU referendum breach the
CHARTER OF FUNDAMENTAL RIGHTS OF THE EU
CH V: CITIZENS' RIGHTS Article 41
Right to good administration
2.     This right includes:
the right of every person to be heard, before any individual measure which would affect him or her adversely is taken;
attributes.additional_details:
The EU Referendum precluded over 2 million EU Nationals living in Britain from voting, the outcome of which will affect them adversely.
If we leave the EU it is likely EU Nationals will stay in Britain and will then have the right to vote in all elections, with a possibility of a coalition government with the SNP and Liberal Democrats calling for a referendum.
The vote to leave the EU has sent shock waves throughout Europe we have a chance to influence the EU and re-unite Europe.

attributes.action: Refunding toll charges in the event of long traffic delays
attributes.background: The purpose of this petition is to request a provision for refund and / or compensation to the drivers on the toll charges who loose time and money due to long traffic delays whilst crossing the toll operated roads, bridges or tunnels on regular basis. Journey's take 5 times longer in long delays.
attributes.additional_details:
Accidents, incidents, maintenance works, weather conditions etc. - lost working time, disruption to family life, and increased stress levels.

Toll charges contribute towards improving the quality of driving and reduce delays. When this fails it would be fair that the operators refund the toll charges during the event of traffic delays.

Rail commuters are entitled for a refund on their season tickets. Similar performance indicator must be operated to toll roads.

attributes.action: Conduct more research into Wilkie Syndrome otherwise known as SMAS.
attributes.background: Superior Mesenteric Artery Syndrome (SMAS) is a digestive condition that occurs when the first part of the small intestine is compressed between two arteries. This compression causes partial or complete blockage of the small intestine. Which causes severe discomfort and drastic weight loss.
attributes.additional_details:
As it stands there is no 'cure' for SMAS (Wilkie Syndrome). I would like more research be conducted to gain a better understanding for the illness and to raise awareness. I believe there could be more people suffering with the syndrome but there isn't enough evidence to support a diagnosis. 
More research could benefit people who currently suffer with the syndrome. I didn't know about the syndrome until I met my friend who has SMAS. I am aiming to help her and possibly other 'SMAS Warriors'.

attributes.action: Ban Beauty Products/Brands which are NOT Cruelty Free in High Street Stores
attributes.background: Stop beauty brands which test ingredients/chemicals on animals in order to make products being sold in high street stores.
attributes.additional_details: Since March 2013, it has been illegal to sell cosmetics products within the EU which have been/which contain ingredients, newly tested on animals. Despite this ingredients used in cosmetics may still be tested on animals in the EU under REACH, the world’s largest chemical testing program. This means that animals will, continue to suffer and die in tests for cosmetics ingredients.

attributes.action: Exempt Charities from paying Insurance Premium Tax (IPT)
attributes.background: We believe the Government should be doing everything it can to support the vital work charities are doing, not imposing unnecessary costs on them. We call for charities to be exempted from Insurance Premium Tax (IPT).
attributes.additional_details: The Government could introduce an exemption from, or reduction in, IPT for all UK Charities. A further rise in the rate of standard UK IPT was announced recently. From 1st June 2017 IPT charged on charities' insurance premiums will increase to 12%. This represents a 100% increase in an 18 month period. These increases have and will continue to negatively affect charities who have already suffered in the last few years from reduced income while seeing an increase in the demand for their services.

attributes.action: Remove the tax on child support for victims of domestic violence.
attributes.background:
The 4 per cent Child Maintenance Service (CMS) collection fee presents real difficulties, particularly for domestic abuse victims.

For victims, a family-based arrangement is mostly impossible to arrange and using the CMS may be the only safe way for victims of domestic abuse to claim support.
attributes.additional_details:
We are calling on the UK Government to protect, not punish victims of domestic violence by removing the 4% collection charge for victim-survivors.

More background information here:

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/child-maintenance-service-single-mother-dwp-snp-child-support-agency-a7505746.html

http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/news/scottish-news/theresa-urged-abolish-cruel-domestic-9446041

http://www.eveningtimes.co.uk/news/14961377.Charge_is____cruel____tax_on_abuse_survivors/

attributes.action: Guarantee rights of all EU citizens in UK as condition of Art 50 notice
attributes.background:
If the UK claims to open to the world, it needs to lead by example. 

It is the right thing to do morally and will create goodwill with the EU/other Member States. As a by product, it means they will come under pressure to reciprocate for UK citizens in the EU.

attributes.action: make babys able to be registered from 16 weeks & death certificates to be given
attributes.background:
I'm starting this petition to try make it so all babies can be registered from 16 weeks and death certificates can be given even if the baby never took a breath. 
Please help me to make this happen, it would mean so much to so many people who have been in the same situation as myself. Thank you.
attributes.additional_details: I lost one of my twin girls to TTTS at 19 weeks and although I will never forget my girl, she will never be truly recognised as a baby by law because she died before 24 weeks. It hurts me daily knowing I will never have that certificate to prove her existence to her twin sister, I would do anything to be able to see my little girl recognised. Just 1 little piece of paper might seem like nothing but for someone who has lost their beautiful baby it could mean the world. 1 signature costs nothing.

attributes.action: To review the sentencing guidelines for offences of deliberate animal cruelty
attributes.background: The existing penalties for animal cruelty are far too lenient and do not act as a deterrent. The sentencing guidelines for offences under the Animal Health Act need reviewing to introduce much tougher sentences for deliberately & wilfully causing suffering and death to animals, eg minimum sentences
attributes.additional_details: Our existing animal welfare legislation is rooted in times when animals were seen as possessions, chattels, or tools of a trade. The current maximum sentences available do nothing to deter the people who indulge in deliberate cruelty for "fun", or who take part in dog fighting or other illegal activities. The introduction of a minimum custodial sentence on conviction of say, three or four years, with no remission or parole, would act as more of a threat to these people and make them think twice.

attributes.action: Theresa May should allow the elected Scottish Government decide Referendum Date
attributes.background:
Theresa May aims to block the Scottish Referendum due to the upcoming Brexit Talks and feels that this should not take place until after Brexit. 

The SNP aim to offer a referendum question when Brexit Talks are near completion and the British Government are aware of their position.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-scotland-39293513 

http://www.newstatesman.com/politics/staggers/2017/03/brexit-makes-scottish-independence-much-more-economically-attractive

attributes.action: petition the government to stop or at least suspend foreign aid
attributes.background: we have so many issues within the UK that we ned to re-examine whether we can afford foreign aid.
attributes.additional_details: We are struggling to maintain front line services, have people living from food banks in poverty and homelessness is on the rise. On the other hand we are spending a huge amount of money on foreign aid, giving it to countries who can afford to run a space program for example? We see on a daily basis that this money is abused - i believe this money would be better spent on issues within the UK supporting our own people.

attributes.action: Stop sending Aid abroad, spend it at home.
attributes.background: Due to the fact People in this Country are needing help and Most if not all of the Countries we give money to, do not in fact need it as they are richer that us. Spend the Money on asylum seekers, Community Care, Pensioners and The NHS
attributes.additional_details: I am a Pensioner and a Carer and it is disgusting that I now have to pay for Services that are free to low income families, when We get just over the limit.

attributes.action: Introduce an unconditional, Universal Basic Income
attributes.background:
Working people face unemployment or reduced hours/wages as their jobs are increasingly taken by machines, yet political austerity focusses on reducing welfare.
Pay a Basic Income to every citizen to reduce welfare bureaucracy, increase quality of life, and maintain consumer spending in the economy.
attributes.additional_details:
Checkout staff, bank tellers, hospital porters, factory workers, receptionists and warehouse workers are already being displaced by technology. They are soon to be followed by lorry drivers, backroom legal teams, financial analysts, call centre staff, pharmacists, etc. All this is happening far faster than workers can retrain.

(Read 'The Rise of The Robots' by Martin Ford for more.)

A Universal Basic Income eliminates almost all bureaucratic costs of social welfare yet achieves the same aim.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for Landlord to discriminate against people on Housing Benefits
attributes.background: Most private landlords, letting agancies and even mortgage companies stipulate in their terms and conditions, that the house can not be rented to anyone on benefits.  With very low stock of social housing this has created a housing crisis for poorer people and families.
attributes.additional_details: This is discrimination against a group of people,  based on an assumption of negative traits and should be declared illegal.

attributes.action: Child maintenance payments to be worked out from NET pay not GROSS pay.
attributes.background: Child maintenance should be work out for the paying parent from there NET pay NOT from there GROSS pay as the working parent does not even see nor take home in the bank the GROSS pay so they are getting penalized twice from the tax man and Child maintenance
attributes.additional_details:
Example: - Parent on £36,000 per year GROSS pay. 
Actual take home pay £24,000 per year NET pay. 
Child maintenance work out your weekly pay from £36,000 this would be £692.00 per week in pay. When actually your weekly take home pay is £461.00 
Action needs to be taken so that child maintenance is worked out from your NET pay not your GROSS pay as parents just cannot afford to live taking money from parents that do not even see this in the bank accounts. 

Please sign and make this happen for the paying parent. Everyone should pay for there child but it has to be fair.

attributes.action: Amend PIP rules so that mentally disabled adults can get a Blue parking Badge
attributes.background:
Currently rules on personal independence payments mean that mobility points, which allow people to access a Blue Badge for disabled parking, are allocated on a physical capacity to walk only not mental impairment. 
This is demonstrably unrealistic & impacts both people with disabilities and carers.
attributes.additional_details: My 19 year old learning disabled daughter Emily can physically walk but this doesn't mean she can do so safely.My Mum had dementia she was able to walk but unable to appreciate the dangers around her. A Blue Badge is a passport to understanding and to life,to refuse to allocate one unless a persons capacity to walk is affected, is morally and factually wrong. This needs to be addressed and urgently amended so that all disabled people are treated equally by the authorities and by society.

attributes.action: Revoke bedside charges for patients in NHS.
attributes.background:
For 69 years the NHS has been a shining example to the world of high quality universal and comprehensive healthcare, free at the point of use. 
The introduction of charges to non-EEA citizens will eliminate the NHS as we know it.
Doctors' priority is to treat patients, not to act as border guards.
attributes.additional_details:
Our NHS is in grave danger, not because of health tourists, but because of a market system, private sector inefficiency and crippling PFI debts. Checking the identity of patients to recoup <0.5% of the budget from health tourists will be expensive and costly with minimal benefit. It will also encourage inequality of provision, poorer clinical outcomes, racial profiling and will undermine the professional duties healthcare professionals must abide by. 
Doctors and nurses demand this is revoked.
